availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Sanks Brisbin (Superintendent of U.S. Army troops in Kentucky)

body.p: Centre County, Pennsylvania, teacher and soldier. Pennsylvania native. Attended Boalsburg Academy. Married to Amelia Wilson Brisbin. Commissioned as second lieutenant in the First Dragoons in the U.S. Army on April 26, 1861. Colonel of the 5th U.S. Colored Cavalry. Brevetted major general of volunteers. Superintendent of U.S. Army troops in Kentucky in spring 1865. Mustered out of service on January 15, 1866.

ab.bibl:
The United States War Department, The war of the rebellion: a compilation of the official records of the Union and Confederate armies, series 1, vol. 49, pt. 1, (Washington: Government Printing Office, 1897), 895.

Find A Grave, “MG James Sanks Brisbin (1837-1892),” Memorial #5892343, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/5892343 (accessed June 5, 2017).
